page.title: 16ANNUAL EVENTS 3
page.content: Other annual events are the School's Nativity Play. Christmas Carol Service in the Church and the singing of Christmas carols in the bar of the Luttrell Arms Hotel on Christmas Eve, this includes the singing of the Dunster Carol and another village adaptation of a Christmas carol called the 'Roller'. By tradition a faggot is place on the fire. The faggot used to be supplied by the Castle. Punch is served at this event and mince pies supplied. It is said that every time the faggot crackles another sip of punch should be taken! On May Day the Hobby Horse cavorts through the village accompanied by musicians on accordian and drums. The children on the village follow the Hobby Horse which often chases them and young girls. Scouts and Guides mark St.George's Day
